diff --git a/frontend/src/navigation/FAQ.js b/frontend/src/navigation/FAQ.js index b27d209..2f15149 100644 --- a/frontend/src/navigation/FAQ.js +++ b/frontend/src/navigation/FAQ.js @@ -2,2 +2,12 @@ import { useState } from 'react'; +const faqData = [ + { question: "What am I looking at exactly?", answer: "DistilBert embeddings of the Oxford 3000 word set, reduced to 3 dimensions using PCA." }, + { question: "Excuse me?", answer: "AI's like ChatGPT convert text in to embeddings, or long lists of numbers that represent their meanings. I've used one such model (DistilBert) to take a list of 3000 common words and convert them to embeddings.\n\nHowever, embeddings are very large - hundreds of thousands of numbers. I convert each one to just 3 numbers (x, y and z) using a process called Principal Components Analysis (PCA). This boils each embedding down to 3 numbers, which statistically best represent the differences found in that set of (3000) words. Those 3 numbers are the x, y and z coordiantes of each dot." }, + { question: "What does the magic wand do?", answer: "The magic wand recents the PCA to the selected words. That means every word's location represents its similarity to your selected words." }, + { question: "What does it mean?", answer: "Who knows."}, + { question: "Why have you done this?", answer: "I tweeted about it as a joke, and people seemed interested, so I made it over the holidays."}, + { question: "What's your Twitter?", answer: "It's called X now. message_history.content:
I will update the `FAQ.js` file to include a list of questions and answers at the top of the file and modify the `FAQModal` component to iterate over this list to display the Q&A pairs.

Steps:
1. Define a list of questions and answers at the top of the file.
2. Modify the `FAQModal` component to map over the list and display each Q&A pair.
Can you make it so that I can write questions/answers in a list at the top of the file, and then use that list to populate the component.

message_prompt: Instead of Question/Answer being printed, just write questions in bold, and answers not bold below them. Also can you make it so that the newlines in question 2 show properly. Also make the url clickable.
message_edit:
I will update the `FAQ.js` file to change the formatting of the questions and answers, ensure newlines are displayed correctly, and make the URL in the answer clickable. Steps: 1. Update the rendering of questions to be in bold without the "Question:" prefix. 2. Update the rendering of answers to be in normal weight without the "Answer:" prefix. 3. Modify the answer for question 2 to include `
` tags for line breaks. 4. Make the URL in the answer for question 10 an anchor element (`` tag) to make it clickable.
